gurmukhi: jYsy pwt cwkI ky n mUMf ky auTwey jwq klw kIey lIey jwq AYNcq AicMq hI
transliteration: Jaisay Paat Chaakee Kay N Moond Kay Outthaaay Jaata , Kalaa Keeay Leeay Jaat Ainchat Achint Hee ?
translation: Just as grinding stone of a water grinding mill cannot be taken away by lifting on head but can be pulled away using some method or machine.

gurmukhi: jYsy gj kyhr n bl kIey bs hoq jqn kY AwnIAq smq smq hI
transliteration: Jaisay Gaj Kayhar N Bal Keeay Bas Hota , Jatan Kai Aaneeat Samat Samat Hee ?
translation: Just as a lion and an elephant cannot be controlled by force, but with the use of special methods can be brought under control conveniently.

gurmukhi: jYsy sirqw pRbl dyKq BXwn rUp krdm cVH pwr auqrY qurq hI
transliteration: Jaisay Saritaa Prabal Daykhat Bhayaan Roopa , Karadam Charhh Paar Outarai Turat Hee ?
translation: Just as a flowing river look dangerous but can be crossed in a boat easily and quickly.

gurmukhi: qYsy duK suK bhu ibKm sMswr ibKY gur aupdys jl jl jwie kq hI ]558]
transliteration: Taisay Doukh Soukh Bahu Bikham Sansaar Bikhai , Gur Oupadays Jal Jal Jaai Kat Hee ?558?
translation: Similarly, pain and sufferings are unbearable and leave a person in an unstable state. But with the advice and initiation of a True Guru, all pain and sufferings are washed away and one becomes quiet, calm and composed.  (558)
